> Presentation prepared as introduction to Git for master students in
> Statistics at Stockholm University

### Aim

This presentation aims to give a very brief introduction to Git and
Github, followed by a short live demo. All the commands used in the demo
are given in the presentation.

### Instructor

<img src="/misc/villani_foto.jpg" width="15%"/>\
[Mattias Villani](https://mattiasvillani.com)<br> Professor of
Statistics<br> Stockholm University

### Before the presentation

-   [Install git](https://git-scm.com/install/)

-   Make a [Github](https://github.com/) account.

### Material

-   [A brief intro to Git](gitintro.qmd)
-   [Live demo](gitdemo.qmd)

### Tooling

-   [Git for Windows](https://gitforwindows.org/) (includes Git bash,
    which is Linux/Mac/Unix-like terminal on Windows, which will match
    with Git tutorials online)

-   [VS code](https://code.visualstudio.com/) (IDE with useful git tools
    integrated)

-   [Git
    Lens](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=eamodio.gitlens)
    for VS Code (supercharge git with an extension)

-   [Gitkraken](https://www.gitkraken.com/) (very comprehensive software
    to work with Git)

-   [Rstudio](https://posit.co/download/rstudio-desktop/) (RStudio has
    git tools built in. Only shown when Rstudio detects a git
    repository)

-   [Meld](https://meldmerge.org/) (git merge tool, to help you when you
    get a merge conflict)
